data.event: In July 2006, Money magazine ranked Fairfield the ninth "best place to live" in the United States, and the best place to live in the Northeast.

event.title: 1635, Puritans and Congregationalists in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, dissatisfied

data.event: In 1635, Puritans and Congregationalists in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, dissatisfied with the rate of Anglican reforms, sought to establish an ecclesiastical society subject to their own rules and regulations.
The Massachusetts General Court granted them permission to settle the towns of Windsor, Wethersfield, and Hartford in the area now known as Connecticut.

event.title: January 14, 1639, a set of legal and administrative regulations called

data.event: On January 14, 1639, a set of legal and administrative regulations called the Fundamental Orders was adopted, and established Connecticut as a self-ruled entity.
By 1639 these settlers had started new towns in the surrounding areas.
